availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1862-1863

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Jefferson County } Ss

Charles H Warner being already sworn upon his oath States that on or about the 13th day of July 1862 at the county aforesaid One Stephen A Harrison did Feloniously Steal take and Carry Away the Sum of Twelve Hundred dollars in Bank notes of the Value of Twelve Hundred dollars, Said Bank notes then & there being the Property of and belonging to affiant And Said Stephen A Harrison fled from the Commonwealth of Kentucky to the City of Milwaukie in the State of Wisconsin, and is now in Said last mentioned City & State, a fugitive from Justice and further saith not,
Subscribed & Sworn to by Charles H Warner before me the 29th December 1862

p.hi:
Jno Talbott Examiner
for Jefferson County

body.p: Jos. Clement Justice of the peace Jeff co K.Y.

Wisconsin
Commonwealth of Ky
vs } Affidavits
Stephen A Harrison
Felony
Requisition Issd
Decr 230. 1862
Delos T. Bligh
Agent
